1.text: Remove the lower stalk of the plant with a knife.

2.text: Wash the dill off thoroughly with cool water.

3.text: Dry off the herbs with a paper towel.

4.text: Chop the dill into coarse pieces.

5.text: Place the herbs onto a cookie sheet in a single layer.

6.text: Set the cookie sheet in the freezer for 12 hours.

7.text: Stick the frozen dill in a freezer-safe plastic bag.

9.text: Freeze dill in oil if you plan to use it in sauces or stews.

10.text: Chop the dill into coarse, evenly-sized pieces.

11.text: Fill the ice cube wells with dill and olive oil.

12.text: Cover the ice cube tray in plastic wrap.

13.text: Let the oil cubes freeze overnight.

14.text: Place the cubes into freezer bags for long-term storage.

15.text: Pick the fronds off of the dill stems.

16.text: Blend 2 cups (20 g) of dill and 2 tsp (11.4 g) of salt in a food processor.

17.text: Add in 1 cup (240 mL) of olive oil to the mixture.

18.text: Pour the paste into an ice cube tray.

20.text: Place the sauce cubes in double-layered freezer-bags for 4 months.
